description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

Google Express is Google's online marketplace that connects merchant retailers and users. The Product Operations (Customer Experience, Trust and Safety team) at Google Express partners with Product Management, Engineering, and Operations to design and build next-generation e-commerce tools and systems. You'll join a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment focused on future-looking capabilities. In this role, you'll design product features and supporting operational processes to drive operational efficiency at global scale. Your role will be highly cross-functional, and you will steward complex programs through an end-to-end development lifecycle—from ideation through implementation.

Users come first at Google. Nowhere is this more important than on our Advertising & Commerce team: we believe that ads and commercial information can be highly useful to our users if, and only if, that information is relevant to what our users wish to find or do. Advertisers worldwide use Google Ads to promote their products; publishers use AdSense to serve relevant ads on their website; and business around the world use our products (like Google Shopping, and Google Wallet) to support their online businesses and bring users into their offline stores. We build and maintain the platforms that have made Google what it is today, and are constantly innovating to deliver the most effective advertising and commerce opportunities of tomorrow.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, economics, mathematics, or statistics, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in program management and working/partnering with operations.
  • Experience in problem solving, capacity modeling, and analysis.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA degree or similar graduate degree in management science, industrial engineering, operations research, or related fields.
  • Experience working in operations and/or with systems for e-commerce or marketplace, trust and safety (e.g. fraud, abuse management).
  • Excellent project leadership skills and demonstrated self-direction in high-growth environments.
  • Effective communication skills; proven ability to engage across a broad range of organizational levels and functions.
  • Proven leadership in ambiguous environments.
responsibilities:
• Define e-commerce systems to power fulfillment operations at Google's global scale.
  • Understand user needs and frame them as opportunities, then devise and prioritize the most impactful solutions.
  • Lead a cross-functional roadmap to build technical capabilities to improve operational efficiency.
  • Marshall resources to execute in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment of continuous improvement.
title: Google Express Program Manager, Product Operations
